subject: Creativity
title: Drugs and Creativity: The Dangerous Romantic Myth
description: A quick, practical guide to Drugs and Creativity: The Dangerous Romantic Myth.

hook.text: Coleridge wrote Kubla Khan on opium. Hendrix played guitar on LSD. The myth: drugs unlock creativity.

buildup.text: Studies show substance use may lower inhibitions temporarily, making people FEEL more creative â€” but objective creative.

discovery.text: A systematic review found alcohol impairs divergent thinking. Cannabis reduces working memory.

twist.text: Artists who used drugs were creative DESPITE substances, not because of them.

climax.text: The 27 Club (Hendrix, Joplin, Morrison, Cobain, Winehouse) shows the real cost.

punchline.text: Drugs don't create creativity. They destroy the creators.

quiz.question: What do studies show about drugs and creative output?
options: People FEEL more creative but objective output doesn't improve
Drugs have no effect at all
